bug.author: opencv-pushbot
bug.summary: Possible memory leak in cvtColor with TBB support
bug.description:
Transferred from http://code.opencv.org/issues/4489 || Guilherme FÃ´lego on 2015-07-20 14:16 || Priority: Normal || Affected: 2.4.9 (latest release) || Category: None || Tracker: Bug || Difficulty: || PR: || Platform: x64 / Linux Possible memory leak in cvtColor with TBB support I'm running some tests with cvtColor and valgrind reports a memory leak. The original post is here: http://answers.opencv.org/question/66185 My first test was using OpenCV 2.4.8 that ships with Ubuntu 14.04.2 LTS (apt-get). My second test was using OpenCV 2.4.11 from GitHub (https://github.com/Itseez/opencv/archive/2.4.11.zip), which seems to be the latest 2.4 release. So I was not sure which "Affected version" to select. Some information about the environment: 
$ lsb_release -a
No LSB modules are available.
Distributor ID: Ubuntu
Description:    Ubuntu 14.04.2 LTS
Release:    14.04
Codename:   trusty

$ uname --all
Linux  3.16.0-34-generic #47~14.04.1-Ubuntu SMP Fri Apr 10 17:49:16 UTC 2015 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux

$ g++ --version
g++ (Ubuntu 4.8.4-2ubuntu1~14.04) 4.8.4
Copyright (C) 2013 Free Software Foundation, Inc.
This is free software; see the source for copying conditions.  There is NO
warranty; not even for MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.

$ valgrind --version
valgrind-3.10.0.SVN
This is a short standalone sample: 
$ cat test.cpp
#include 
#include 
#include 

int main()
{
    std::cout << cv::getBuildInformation() << std::endl;

    cv::Mat src = cv::Mat::zeros(5, 5, CV_8UC3);
    cv::Mat dst;

    cv::cvtColor( src, dst, CV_BGR2GRAY );
}
Building OpenCV 2.4.11: 
$ cmake -D CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=RELEASE -D CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX= ..
$ make -j9
$ make -j9 install
Building sample: 
$ g++ -Wall -Wextra -Werror -Weffc++ -ansi -pedantic -O2 test.cpp -o test -I/include/opencv /lib/libopencv_core.so /lib/libopencv_imgproc.so
And the output: 
$ LD_LIBRARY_PATH=/lib/:$LD_LIBRARY_PATH valgrind --leak-check=full ./test
==18997== Memcheck, a memory error detector
==18997== Copyright (C) 2002-2013, and GNU GPL'd, by Julian Seward et al.
==18997== Using Valgrind-3.10.0.SVN and LibVEX; rerun with -h for copyright info
==18997== Command: ./test
==18997==

Now, building OpenCV 2.4.11 with TBB support: 
$ cmake -D CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=RELEASE -D CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX= -D WITH_TBB=ON ..
$ make -j9
$ make -j9 install
Building the sample with the new library: 
$ g++ -Wall -Wextra -Werror -Weffc++ -ansi -pedantic -O2 test.cpp -o test -I/include/opencv /lib/libopencv_core.so /lib/libopencv_imgproc.so
And the new output:
